Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2011 02:54PM oandtolivo wrote: Hi rabbit, I'm 7 days out from my 2nd FEC. I got very sick for the first 12hour both times.  The first week is really hard and the metallic taste sticks around for a while. Just try to drink what you can and rinse with baking soda and salt water twice a day. My nausea meds just don't seem to work and the onc will need to try something else next time.  Hang in there.  It should get a little bit better each day.  My hair started to come out on day 14 so be prepared. Good luck Tracy
Posts.Title: sick on the first day? rabbit rabbit
Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2011 05:54AM oandtolivo wrote: rabbit I'm on day 9 from second Doc and I'm not doing so great.  I would still take the Doc of FEC, but I'm now loosing a big toe nail and my rt hand hurts. It feels like l've got a cord running from my shoulder to my thumb.  I was really sick all weekend and everything I eat tastes like Chalk.  I really hope you don't get any of this, but it's nice to have a heads-up.  I love food and it's hard to eat when you can't taste.  My white count is very low again and I'm getting an eye infection.  It's hard, but I'm just telling myself "only one more to go".  Hang in there and good luck with #2. chiluvr1228 Everyone is different, but many of us want to know what could happen to prepare for the worst and be happy if we're spared.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel/Taxotere question rabbit Trisha-Anne

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 12:46AM oandtolivo wrote: I have control over me, my actions and what I say. Everyone else can do and say whatever they want.  What goes around comes around. I often feel I'm paying a price for something in my passed and now I can make good of this or continue to pay a price.  I choose good for the sake of my children  It is hard to let things slid off your back, but after a while I'm glad I let it go.  I've had a few people realize how insensitive they been or rude and they've apologized.  They have to live with themselves not me!  Is everyone having their blood taken every week? or is it just a finger stick?  I'm just getting a finger stick for red/white and hemo.
Posts.Title: Chemo May 2011 Cyborg

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 05:51AM oandtolivo wrote: I had my last chemo Monday and I'm so happy that part is behind me.   I'm just tired of everyone telling me or acting like it's ALL OVER!  I'm sorry, but I'm not even close.  Rads and shots and pills and more Sx.  We're talking years of crap and the constant worry that it will all come crashing back.  I just don't know what to say anymore.  Maybe "yeah, it's all over" , then just walk away.  I feel like I have to educate all these poeple, have they not heard of google.  Sorry for venting.  I hope everyone is doing well and those who aren't hang in there we're all thinking of you.
Posts.Title: Chemo May 2011 Cyborg

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 07:29AM oandtolivo wrote: Congrates Beaglegirl. Is anyone coming to the end of herceptin?  I'm a little nervous about the end.  Going from every 3 weeks to see you in 6 months seems scary.  Is anyone else feeling this way? Thanks Tracy

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2011 08:48AM oandtolivo wrote: Hot flashes are the worst. Doctor said it's menopause, but I think not I've had 3 of the worst periods on chemo and there are right on time.  I had my first Doc w/herceptin yesterday and an over night at the hospital.  So far so good.  I'm just happy to be done with FEC and the 12h vomiting.  Hugs to everyone not feel so great, hang in there.
Posts.Title: Chemo May 2011 Cyborg

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 09:38AM oandtolivo wrote: Wow, no wonder most ladies on here have a port!  My two weeks off I only get a finger stick.  I'd hate to give up a vein very week.

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2011 10:32AM oandtolivo wrote: One more FEC Monday and I'm not looking forward to it! So ready to start T and not spend 12 hours vomiting. I'll never drink anything red again. I can't even look at a red drink without feeling sick.  I hope everyone has a great weekend. **** Tracy

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2011 12:04AM oandtolivo wrote: bkj66  The F in FEC is Fluorouracil (5FU), I'm so glad i'm done with that. Major chemo brian!
Posts.Title: Chemo May 2011 Cyborg

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2011 12:03AM - edited Jul 22, 2011 12:09AM by oandtolivo blondelawyer I had my rt mx in May.  It took a while to get use to being a DD on one side and AA on the other, but I've healed well and I know a year will go fast.  Plus, the mx bras and prosthesis are pretty comfy and no one can tell I'm missing anything.  I must admit it would have been nice to drop both DD for a while.  You'll do great and hang in there. I'm having the worst week yet.  That last FEC really kicked me hard.  I'm so grateful for all my friends and family.  I feel like the worst mom this week I can't even play cars or finish a board game.
